entities.descriptionArabic: نبي أرسله الله إلى فرعون وبني إسرائيل، نشأ في بيت فرعون ثم فر إلى مدين ثم عاد برسالة الله
entities.descriptionEnglish: Prophet sent by Allah to Pharaoh and the Children of Israel, raised in Pharaoh's household, fled to Midian, then returned with Allah's message

entities.descriptionArabic: أخو موسى، أرسله الله معه وزيراً ومعيناً في تبليغ الرسالة لفرعون
entities.descriptionEnglish: Brother of Moses, sent by Allah as his minister and helper in delivering the message to Pharaoh

entities.descriptionArabic: خليل الله، بشّر بأن من ذريته من يكون هلاك ملك مصر على يديه
entities.descriptionEnglish: The Friend of Allah (Khalil), foretold that from his lineage would come one who would cause the downfall of Egypt's king

entities.descriptionArabic: خاتم الأنبياء، المخاطب في سورة القصص بقصة موسى للعبرة والتثبيت
entities.descriptionEnglish: The final Prophet, addressed in Surah Al-Qasas with the story of Moses for lesson and reassurance

entities.descriptionArabic: ملك مصر الجبار المتكبر الذي استعبد بني إسرائيل وذبّح أبناءهم وادعى الألوهية
entities.descriptionEnglish: The tyrannical king of Egypt who enslaved the Children of Israel, slaughtered their sons, and claimed divinity

entities.descriptionArabic: وزير فرعون، أمره فرعون ببناء صرح ليطلع إلى إله موسى
entities.descriptionEnglish: Pharaoh's minister, commanded by Pharaoh to build a tower to reach the God of Moses

entities.descriptionArabic: امرأة فرعون، التقطت موسى من النهر وأقنعت فرعون بتبنيه، آمنت بالله
entities.descriptionEnglish: Wife of Pharaoh, rescued baby Moses from the river and convinced Pharaoh to adopt him, believed in Allah

entities.descriptionArabic: أوحى الله إليها أن ترضعه وتلقيه في اليم، ردّه الله إليها فأرضعته بأجر
entities.descriptionEnglish: Divinely inspired to nurse Moses and cast him into the river; Allah returned him to her and she nursed him for wages

entities.descriptionArabic: تتبعت أثر موسى حين ألقي في النهر ودلت آل فرعون على أمها لإرضاعه
entities.descriptionEnglish: Tracked baby Moses after he was cast into the river and guided Pharaoh's household to her mother to nurse him

entities.descriptionArabic: من قوم موسى، آتاه الله كنوزاً عظيمة فبغى وتكبر فخسف الله به وبداره الأرض
entities.descriptionEnglish: From the people of Moses, given immense treasures by Allah but became arrogant, so Allah caused the earth to swallow him and his dwelling

entities.descriptionArabic: الشيخ الكبير في مدين الذي زوّج موسى ابنته مقابل أن يأجره ثماني حجج
entities.descriptionEnglish: The elder of Midian who married his daughter to Moses in exchange for eight years of service

entities.descriptionArabic: إحدى ابنتي شعيب، تزوجها موسى بعد أن سقى لهما، قالت عنه إنه القوي الأمين
entities.descriptionEnglish: One of Shu'ayb's two daughters, married Moses after he watered their flock, described him as strong and trustworthy

entities.descriptionArabic: رجل جاء من أقصى المدينة يسعى لينذر موسى بأن الملأ يأتمرون به ليقتلوه
entities.descriptionEnglish: A man who came running from the far end of the city to warn Moses that the chiefs were plotting to kill him

entities.descriptionArabic: رب العالمين، منزل الكتاب ومرسل الرسل ومهلك الظالمين
entities.descriptionEnglish: Lord of all creation, revealer of the Book, sender of messengers, and destroyer of oppressors

entities.descriptionArabic: من أسماء الله، غفر لموسى حين استغفره بعد قتل القبطي
entities.descriptionEnglish: Names of Allah; He forgave Moses when he sought forgiveness after killing the Copt

entities.descriptionArabic: القوم الذين استضعفهم فرعون وذبّح أبناءهم، أرسل الله إليهم موسى لتحريرهم
entities.descriptionEnglish: The people oppressed by Pharaoh who slaughtered their sons; Allah sent Moses to liberate them

entities.descriptionArabic: أهل مصر من أتباع فرعون الذين استعبدوا بني إسرائيل
entities.descriptionEnglish: The Egyptian people, followers of Pharaoh who enslaved the Children of Israel

entities.descriptionArabic: أهل مدين الذين عاش موسى بينهم وتزوج منهم
entities.descriptionEnglish: The people of Midian among whom Moses lived and from whom he married

entities.descriptionArabic: أرض فرعون حيث استُعبد بنو إسرائيل ونشأ موسى
entities.descriptionEnglish: The land of Pharaoh where the Children of Israel were enslaved and Moses was raised

entities.descriptionArabic: البلد الذي فرّ إليه موسى من مصر وعاش فيه ثماني أو عشر سنين
entities.descriptionEnglish: The land where Moses fled from Egypt and lived for eight or ten years

entities.descriptionArabic: الوادي الذي ناجى الله فيه موسى عند الشجرة من جانب الطور الأيمن
entities.descriptionEnglish: The sacred valley where Allah spoke to Moses at the tree on the right side of Mount Tur

entities.nameEnglish: The Right Side of Mount Tur (Sinai)
entities.descriptionArabic: المكان الذي رأى فيه موسى النار وكلمه الله منها
entities.descriptionEnglish: The location where Moses saw the fire and Allah spoke to him from it

entities.nameEnglish: The Sea (the Nile / the Red Sea)
entities.descriptionArabic: ألقي فيه موسى رضيعاً، وأغرق الله فيه فرعون وجنوده
entities.descriptionEnglish: Baby Moses was cast into it; Pharaoh and his army were drowned in it

entities.descriptionArabic: بناء أمر فرعون هامان ببنائه من الطوب المحروق ليطلع إلى إله موسى
entities.descriptionEnglish: A tower Pharaoh commanded Haman to build from baked bricks to reach the God of Moses

entities.nameEnglish: Casting of Baby Moses into the River
entities.descriptionArabic: أم موسى ألقت رضيعها في النهر بوحي من الله خوفاً من ذبّاحي فرعون
entities.descriptionEnglish: Moses' mother cast her baby into the river by divine inspiration, fearing Pharaoh's executioners

entities.nameEnglish: Adoption of Moses by Pharaoh's Household
entities.descriptionArabic: التقط آل فرعون موسى من النهر وتبنته آسية، ليكون لهم عدواً وحزناً بقدر الله
entities.descriptionEnglish: Pharaoh's household picked up Moses from the river and Asiyah adopted him — destined by Allah to become their enemy

entities.nameEnglish: Return of Moses to His Mother
entities.descriptionArabic: حرّم الله على موسى المراضع فأرشدت أخته آل فرعون إلى أمه فأرضعته
entities.descriptionEnglish: Allah made Moses refuse all wet-nurses; his sister guided Pharaoh's household to his mother, who nursed him

entities.descriptionArabic: دخل موسى المدينة فوجد إسرائيلياً يتقاتل مع قبطي فوكز القبطي فقضى عليه
entities.descriptionEnglish: Moses entered the city and found an Israelite fighting a Copt; he struck the Copt and killed him

entities.descriptionArabic: فرّ موسى من مصر خائفاً بعد أن علم فرعون بقتله القبطي
entities.descriptionEnglish: Moses fled Egypt in fear after Pharaoh learned of the killing of the Copt

entities.nameEnglish: Moses Watering the Flock of Shu'ayb's Daughters
entities.descriptionArabic: وجد موسى امرأتين تذودان عن الماء فسقى لهما ثم تولى إلى الظل
entities.descriptionEnglish: Moses found two women holding back their flock from the water; he watered for them, then withdrew to shade

entities.nameEnglish: Marriage of Moses to Shu'ayb's Daughter
entities.descriptionArabic: زوّج شعيب موسى إحدى ابنتيه مقابل أجره ثماني حجج
entities.descriptionEnglish: Shu'ayb married his daughter to Moses in exchange for eight years of service

entities.nameEnglish: Allah's Address to Moses at the Fire
entities.descriptionArabic: رأى موسى ناراً عند جانب الطور فلما أتاها نودي من الشجرة وكلمه الله وأعطاه آياته
entities.descriptionEnglish: Moses saw a fire at Mount Tur; when he approached, Allah called him from the tree, spoke to him, and gave him signs

entities.nameEnglish: Drowning of Pharaoh and His Army
entities.descriptionArabic: أهلك الله فرعون وجنوده بالإغراق في البحر عقاباً على كفرهم وطغيانهم
entities.descriptionEnglish: Allah destroyed Pharaoh and his army by drowning them in the sea as punishment for their disbelief and tyranny

entities.descriptionArabic: خسف الله بقارون وبداره الأرض عقاباً على بغيه وكبره
entities.descriptionEnglish: Allah caused the earth to swallow Qarun and his dwelling as punishment for his arrogance and transgression

entities.nameEnglish: Exodus of the Children of Israel
entities.descriptionArabic: خروج بني إسرائيل من مصر بقيادة موسى بعد سنين الاستعباد
entities.descriptionEnglish: The departure of the Children of Israel from Egypt under Moses' leadership after years of enslavement

entities.nameEnglish: Slaughter of the Sons of Bani Israel
entities.descriptionArabic: أمر فرعون بذبح أبناء بني إسرائيل واستحياء نسائهم خوفاً من النبي الموعود
entities.descriptionEnglish: Pharaoh ordered the killing of Israelite boys and sparing their women, fearing the prophesied deliverer

entities.descriptionArabic: العصا التي ألقاها موسى فصارت حية تسعى، آية من آيات الله
entities.descriptionEnglish: The staff Moses cast down and it became a living serpent — a sign from Allah

entities.descriptionArabic: يد موسى حين أدخلها في جيبه خرجت بيضاء تتلألأ من غير سوء، آية من الله
entities.descriptionEnglish: Moses' hand, when placed in his cloak, emerged white and radiant without disease — a sign from Allah

entities.descriptionArabic: الصندوق الذي وضعت فيه أم موسى رضيعها قبل إلقائه في النهر
entities.descriptionEnglish: The chest in which Moses' mother placed her baby before casting him into the river

entities.descriptionArabic: الكتاب الذي أنزله الله على موسى هدى ورحمة
entities.descriptionEnglish: The Book revealed by Allah to Moses as guidance and mercy

entities.descriptionArabic: الكتاب المبين الذي نزلت فيه سورة القصص بقصة موسى وفرعون بالحق
entities.descriptionEnglish: The Clear Book in which Surah Al-Qasas was revealed telling the story of Moses and Pharaoh in truth

entities.descriptionArabic: الاعتماد على الله والثقة بوعده، كما فعلت أم موسى حين ألقته في اليمّ
entities.descriptionEnglish: Trusting in Allah and His promise, as Moses' mother did when she cast him into the river

entities.descriptionArabic: التكبر في الأرض والبغي بغير الحق، كما فعل فرعون وقارون
entities.descriptionEnglish: Arrogance on earth and transgression without right, as exemplified by Pharaoh and Qarun

entities.descriptionArabic: قدر الله الذي لا يُردّ: نشّأ موسى في بيت فرعون رغم محاولته قتل أبناء بني إسرائيل
entities.descriptionEnglish: Allah's irrevocable decree: Moses was raised in Pharaoh's own house despite his attempts to kill Israelite sons

entities.descriptionArabic: صبر أم موسى وصبر بني إسرائيل على استضعاف فرعون
entities.descriptionEnglish: The patience of Moses' mother and the patience of the Children of Israel under Pharaoh's oppression

entities.descriptionArabic: اليوم الذي لا ينفع فيه مال ولا بنون إلا من أتى الله بقلب سليم
entities.descriptionEnglish: The Day when neither wealth nor children will avail, except one who comes to Allah with a sound heart

entities.descriptionArabic: البلد الحرام الذي نزل فيه القرآن على محمد ﷺ وراده الله إليه
entities.descriptionEnglish: The sacred city where the Quran was revealed to Muhammad ﷺ and to which Allah promised to return him

relationships.description: Moses was sent by Allah as a messenger to Pharaoh
Asiyah wife of Pharaoh convinced Pharaoh to adopt baby Moses
Moses is the son of his mother who received divine inspiration to save him
Moses' sister tracked him and arranged his return to their mother
Aaron is Moses' brother, sent with him as a helper
Moses married one of Shu'ayb's daughters after serving him for eight years
Moses served Shu'ayb for eight or ten years as agreed for the marriage
Moses was sent as a prophet and liberator to the Children of Israel
Pharaoh rejected Moses' message, tried to kill him, and persecuted his followers
Pharaoh enslaved the Children of Israel, slaughtered their sons, and spared their women
Pharaoh commanded Haman to build a tower to reach the God of Moses
Pharaoh was the tyrannical ruler of Egypt
Haman was Pharaoh's chief minister who carried out his commands
Haman built Pharaoh's tower from baked bricks at his command
Asiyah was the wife of Pharaoh
Asiyah believed in Allah, guided to faith through raising Moses
Qarun was from the people of Moses (Children of Israel)
Qarun exemplified arrogance and transgression through his pride in his wealth
Pharaoh exemplified arrogance by claiming divinity and oppressing people
She was one of Shu'ayb's two daughters
Came running to warn Moses that the chiefs were plotting to kill him
Moses' mother exemplified trust in Allah by casting her baby into the river on His promise
Moses' mother exemplified patience in enduring the fear and separation from her child
Allah directly spoke to Moses at the burning bush in the sacred valley
Allah inspired Moses' mother to nurse him and cast him into the river
Allah destroyed Pharaoh and his army by drowning them in the sea
Allah caused the earth to swallow Qarun and his dwelling
The Torah was revealed to Moses as guidance and mercy
The Quran containing Surah Al-Qasas was revealed to Muhammad ﷺ
The staff was given to Moses as a miraculous sign — it turned into a serpent
The radiant white hand was given to Moses as a second miraculous sign
Moses' mother placed him in the chest before casting him into the river
Baby Moses was cast into the Nile river
Pharaoh's household found Moses after he was cast into the river
Moses raised by the very person who sought to kill Israelite boys — illustrating divine decree
The killing of the Copt forced Moses to flee Egypt to avoid execution
Moses fled to Midian from Egypt
Moses watering the flock led to meeting Shu'ayb and marrying his daughter
Moses watered the flock at the well of Midian
Allah addressed Moses at the fire in the sacred valley near Mount Tur
The divine address took place on the right side of Mount Tur
Pharaoh ordered the slaughter of Israelite boys
The slaughter campaign forced Moses' mother to cast him into the river
Pharaoh and his army were drowned in the sea
Pharaoh pursued the fleeing Children of Israel and was drowned
Qarun's arrogance and transgression brought about his destruction
Aaron assisted Moses in conveying the message to Pharaoh as his minister
The Forgiving, The Merciful — attributes of Allah who forgave Moses

relationships.context: Introduction: Allah recounts the story of Moses and Pharaoh in truth
Introduction: the story of Moses and Pharaoh
The Quran described as the Clear Book recounting this story
Pharaoh's tyranny described: he divided the people, oppressed a group, slaughtered their sons
The oppressed people whose sons were slaughtered
Pharaoh slaughtered the sons and spared the women
Allah's will to favor the oppressed and make them leaders and inheritors
Allah's will overrides Pharaoh's plans: He will favor the oppressed
Allah will show Pharaoh and Haman what they feared from the Children of Israel
Haman mentioned alongside Pharaoh as those who will see what they feared
Allah inspired her to nurse Moses and cast him into the river
The divine command to cast baby Moses into the river
Allah's promise: do not fear or grieve, We will return him and make him a messenger
Pharaoh's household picked up Moses — destined to be their enemy and grief
Divine irony: Pharaoh adopted the very person who would bring his downfall
Asiyah pleaded to spare baby Moses: 'a comfort to me and you — do not kill him'
Her heart became empty of everything except worry for Moses
Sent by her mother to follow Moses' trail; watched him from a distance
Moses refused all wet-nurses; his sister offered to guide them to a suitable household
Allah returned Moses to his mother to comfort her and prove His promise true
Moses reached maturity and was given wisdom and knowledge
Moses entered the city and struck the Copt, killing him
The killed man was a Copt (Egyptian), enemy of the Israelite
Moses sought forgiveness and Allah forgave him — He is the Forgiving, Merciful
A man came running to warn Moses that the chiefs were plotting to kill him
Moses fled Egypt in fear, praying for Allah to save him from the oppressors
Moses headed toward Midian, hoping his Lord would guide him
Moses found people watering and two women holding back; he watered for them
One of the two daughters came to Moses walking shyly, inviting him to her father
The father (identified as Shu'ayb by scholars) invited Moses and rewarded him
Shu'ayb offered to marry one of his daughters to Moses for eight years of service
After completing the term, Moses saw a fire at Mount Tur and went to investigate
Allah called Moses from the right side of the valley at the blessed spot by the tree
Allah commanded Moses to throw his staff; it became a serpent
Allah commanded Moses to put his hand in his cloak; it came out white and radiant
Moses asked Allah to send Aaron with him as a helper and more eloquent speaker
Pharaoh claimed to know no other god for the people and commanded Haman to build a tower
Pharaoh commanded Haman to build a tower to reach the God of Moses
Allah seized Pharaoh and his armies and cast them into the sea
After destroying earlier generations, Allah gave Moses the Torah as guidance
Muhammad ﷺ was not at the western side of Tur when Moses was commissioned
Addressed directly: you were not present at Tur, but Allah informs you through revelation
The Quraysh claimed following guidance would snatch them from their land — but Makkah is a safe sanctuary
Qarun was from Moses' people but transgressed; given treasures whose keys burdened a group of strong men
Allah caused the earth to swallow Qarun and his dwelling — no group could help him
Qarun's arrogance exemplified — told not to exult, for Allah loves not the exultant
Allah shows Pharaoh and Haman exactly what they feared — divine decree prevails
Pharaoh and his chiefs made leaders inviting to the Fire; on the Day of Judgment they will not be helped
The land where Pharaoh exalted himself and divided the people
Ibn Kathir mentions Abraham's prophecy about the destruction of Egypt's king through his lineage
